Package tools.data.img

Class BoundedImageSheet

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.data.img.ImageSheet
      • tools.data.img.BoundedImageSheet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ManagedImageSheet, ModImageSheet, OverlayImageSheet, SourceImageSheet, SubImageSheet
    public abstract class BoundedImageSheet
extends ImageSheet
    Image sheet abstract implementation for bounded image sheets.
    Bounded image sheets have a width and height and requesting an image within these bounds will never throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException. This requirement does NOT hold for the ImageSheet.getSheet() function.
    Note that it is still allowed to return null for an image.

      • getWidth

        public abstract int getWidth()
        Returns the number of images which are in the width of the image sheet.
        Returns:
        The width of the sheet, counted as the number of images, or -1 if this function is not supported.

      • getHeight

        public abstract int getHeight()
        Returns the number of images which are in the height of the image sheet.
        Returns:
        The height of the sheet, counted as the number of images, or -1 if this function is not supported.

      • getFromRows

        public java.awt.Image getFromRows​(int i)
                           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the i'th image of the row sheet.

        A row sheet is constructed by concatenating all rows of the original sheet.
        Example:
        Sheet indices:
        00 01 02 03
        04 05 06 07
        08 09 10 11
        Then:
        getFromRows(i) == image with index i.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the row image to return.
        Returns:
        The i'th image from the row sheet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index points are outside the allowed range.
        See Also:
        get(int, int)

      • getFromRows

        public java.awt.Image getFromRows​(int i,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  int scaleHints)
                           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the i'th image of the column sheet, scaled to the size of width by height by using the given scale hints.

        A row sheet is constructed by concatenating all rows of the original sheet.
        Example:
        Sheet indices:
        00 01 02 03
        04 05 06 07
        08 09 10 11
        Then:
        getFromRows(i, w, h, sh) == image with index i, scaled to (w x h) using scale hints sh.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the row image to return.
        width - The width of the image to return. -1 if the default width should be used.
        height - The height of the image to return. -1 if the default height should be used.
        scaleHints - The scale hints used for scaling the image.
        Returns:
        The i'th image from the row sheet with the given width and height, and scaled using the scale hints.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index points are outside the allowed range.
        See Also:
        ImageSheet.get(int, int, int, int, int)

      • drawFromRow

        public boolean drawFromRow​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                           int i,
                           int posX,
                           int posY)
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Draws the i'th image of row sheet on the given graphics object. Also translates the image to the given position.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object used to draw on.
        i - The linear row index of the image to draw.
        posX - The amount to translate the image in the x-axis.
        posY - The amount to translate the image in the y-axis.
        Returns:
        true if anything was drawn on the graphics object. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index points are outside the allowed range.
        See Also:
        : For more info about row sheets.

      • drawFromRow

        public boolean drawFromRow​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                           int i,
                           int posX,
                           int posY,
                           int width,
                           int height,
                           int scaleHints)
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Draws the i'th image of row sheet on the given graphics object. Also resizes and translates the image to the given size and position.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object used to draw on.
        i - The linear row index of the image to draw.
        posX - The amount to translate the image in the x-axis.
        posY - The amount to translate the image in the y-axis.
        width - The width of the image to draw.
        height - The height of the image to draw.
        scaleHints - The scale hints used for scaling the image.
        Returns:
        true if anything was drawn on the graphics object. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index points are outside the allowed range.
        See Also:
        : For more info about row sheets.

      • getFromCols

        public java.awt.Image getFromCols​(int i)
                           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the i'th image of the column sheet.

        A column sheet is constructed by concatenating all columns of the original sheet.
        Example:
        Sheet indices:
        00 03 06 09
        01 04 07 10
        02 05 08 11
        Then:
        getFromCols(i) == image with index i.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the column image to return.
        Returns:
        The i'th image from the column sheet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index points are outside the allowed range.
        See Also:
        checkLinearBounds(int), get(int, int)

      • getFromCols

        public java.awt.Image getFromCols​(int i,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  int scaleHints)
                           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the i'th image of the column sheet, scaled to the size of width by height by using the given scale hints.

        A column sheet is constructed by concatenating all columns of the original sheet.
        Example:
        Sheet indices:
        00 03 06 09
        01 04 07 10
        02 05 08 11
        Then:
        getFromCols(i, w, h, sh) == image at i, scaled to (w x h) using scale hints sh.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the column image to return.
        width - The width of the image to return. -1 if the default width should be used.
        height - The height of the image to return. -1 if the default height should be used.
        scaleHints - The scale hints used for scaling the image.
        Returns:
        The i'th image from the column sheet with the given width and height, and scaled using the scale hints.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index points are outside the allowed range.
        See Also:
        checkLinearBounds(int), ImageSheet.get(int, int, int, int, int)

        Checks whether the given value is a valid linear index for image sheet.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of bounds.

      • checkBounds

                                 int y)
        Checks whether the given values are valid indices for this image sheet.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coord to check.
        y - The y-coord to check.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If at least one of the indices is out of bounds.

      • canAccess

        public boolean canAccess​(int x,
                         int y)
        Specified by:
        canAccess in class ImageSheet
        Returns:
        false if requesting the image at (x, y) will always result in an IndexOutOfBoundsException being thrown. true otherwise.

      • asGUIImageSheet

        public GUIImageSheet asGUIImageSheet()
        Creates a GUI image sheet based on this image sheet.
        The created GUI sheet will only return this sheet for all states.
        Returns:
        A GUI image sheet based on this image sheet.
